abstract: Amid the glamour and the French Riviera sun, more and more Wall Street banks, private equity firms and hedge funds are coming to the 12-day Cannes festival – the world’s largest international film market – to try to arrange and finance entertainment deals. Merrill Lynch, Citigroup, and JPMorgan Chase, as well as hedge funds like Atticus Capital and various companies backed by the likes of Providence Equity Partners and the Texas Pacific Group, are all here this year, competing for deals.
lead_paragraph: Amid the glamour and the French Riviera sun, more and more Wall Street banks, private equity firms and hedge funds are coming to the 12-day Cannes festival – the world’s largest international film market – to try to arrange and finance entertainment deals. Merrill Lynch, Citigroup, and JPMorgan Chase, as well as hedge funds like Atticus Capital and various companies backed by the likes of Providence Equity Partners and the Texas Pacific Group, are all here this year, competing for deals.

headline.main: In Cannes, Bankers May Outnumber Movie Stars
